Purchased to go with the inexpensive dive boxes available on Amazon (camera+dive box was cheaper than the dive box for my main SLR).
The dive box I have is:
This camera is amazing.
A small camera with a big sensor.
We took it on a trip to Europe and it fit in the pocket of my jacket but took professional quality images every time.
Specially good in low light and uses HDR automatically if needed.
I got a great photo in a dark Scottish whiskey warehouse with no lights on and no flash - could not believe it.
It is easier than my much more expensive Canon equipment and for 95% of the shots you would take it does just as good a job.
Plus those Canon L lenses are a lot heavier and bigger to tote around.
This is a good camera.
The focus speed is very fast, easy to use

Text.text: Great camera but their mobile app for wirelessly transferring photos leaves a TON to be desired.
It is not easy.
It is not simple.
It is beyond frustrating.
This is my first mirrorless camera (Nikon D7100 previously) and the pictures on this thing are awesome.
However, the difficulty I've encountered in trying to connect my photos to my iPhone have honestly made me wish I would have stuck with Nikon.
If you have an iPhone, seriously give some thought on how you'd like to transfer your photos.
If you want to do it wirelessly...find another camera.
Best camera purchase!!
I was hoping to replace my Canon EOS-M3 with this camera as the Canon's detachable viewfinder makes the camera kind of awkward to store when it's attached to the camera.
But the images with the Sony a6000 couldn't compare with Canon's and Canon's viewfinder is far superior.
So, I decided to return the Sony and stick with the Canon.
I'm sure at some point Canon will update their design and have a built-in viewfinder.
Meanwhile I really appreciate the quality of the M3 images and will just have to make do with a bit larger carrying case!

Its basically good picture performance is the only thing that prevents me from giving it a zero.

It's intuitive to use, whether you just want to point-and-shoot or if you want to go into manual mode to snap the perfect shot (either way you use it the photos will be fantastic).
This is a great camera, I'm an amateur at photography but with this camera, my shots come out like professionals.
I'm still learning.
Great camera!

You can spend a lot more money, but if you're not making money with it it's probably a waste.

BOY I AM UNHAPPY.
I bought a Sony A6000 as a small carry camera.
Very disappointing!!!
The photographs are of average quality but that is what I kind of expected as I am accustomed to the high quality images of Nikon and Canon.
The video, WHO KNOWS, I cannot even download it to view let alone edit it to a common format and burn to DVD.
It seems to be a Sony proprietary format.
I have spent many hours looking for software that will convert it to a common format for editing and burning, So far no success!
I have the Sony Movie Studio Platinum 12 and it is not compatible.
I downloaded the Sony PlayMemoriesHome and it tells me it will not accept the format either.
This Sony software wants to control your whole system of video and photographs and that is NOT ACCEPTABLE as I use many types of software depending on the photograph type and content.
It burns up batteries and only takes between 50 to 75 photographs and I must change batteries.
If one leave the camera dormant for a few days, even though it was100% at the time, the battery has run done and you have to recharge it.

Review.author: W. Lockwood
Review.title: Decent camera maybe, but terrible documentation and poor standard lens ruin the experience

Text.text: I've been a photographer for my entire lifetime and was excited to get the a6000 based on reviews.
This is my first and perhaps last Sony camera product I will own.
So far I have owned it for a month and I must say that I am disappointed with the camera.
The main issue is that instead of being an enhancement, the technology side of the camera is in your face, literally.
The issue here is the absolutely abysmal documentation.
All that comes with the camera is a poor quick start guide.
Maybe I am spoiled by my previous cameras, which have all been Canons.
Their documentation have been excellent even as their cameras became more electronic and complex.
The other issue is the stock lens.
They are disappointingly soft.
This camera is just the right size and takes wonderful pictures.
I currently am using my old Canon F1 lenses via adapters with great success.
I only wish the Sony lenses were more reasonably priced as most of them are the cost of the camera and more.
My favorite lens is the 35-105 Canon FD zoom, which with the adapter, makes it a well balanced piece of equipment.

The zooms are do not touch these and if a zoom is truly needed I would suggest a different system.
Everything about this camera is great, except one thing.
Wonderful for beginners

THERE IT IS .. that perfect opportunity.
Or perhaps you want to go for a bike ride, a walk in the park, maybe down the street for a cuppa joe.
It's way better than any cell phone wannabe camera that simply isn't going to get it done.

Review.author: P. Carpineta
Review.title: Light weight and compact mirrorless camera

Text.text: The camera, plus good lenses, equals to a great performance.
Even for a 2014 model!
The Sony a6000 is an amazing little compact camera for my food photography needs.
I manage social media for a restaurant and while my Nikon is an excellent camera, it does not have the capability to communicate with my phone (though I could probably get an adapter).

But I am able to shoot, transfer to my phone, edit photos in my mobile photoshop app and post real time whereas with mg Nikon, I have to take out my memory card, insert to laptop, edit in the real lightroom, save and post.
It just takes mich longer.
But the Sony a6000 has been great and transfers photos in less than 5 seconds.

Review.author: Mike
Review.title: Quick to use, Very fast and lightweight. Just a few quirks...

Text.text: At this time I'm not sure I could recommend buying the Sony A6000 camera.
After researching multiple cameras for a dependable, lightweight and powerful cam for traveling I transitioned from my Nikon 3400 DSLR to the Sony A6000 with high hopes.
I initially got used to the lens 16-50mm having slightly dark edges and even chalked up the blurred images to my amateurish abilities with a new camera.
Unfortunately, what I cannot ignore is how the camera does not always function when needed.
I've had the battery go from 50% to zero while on a gorgeous evening walk making me switch to my cell phone cam for backup.

Another issue that seems to be getting worse since I bought this just shy of a month ago is the software occasionally seizes like a computer having a driver issue and requires me to power off then on (reboot) to reset it.
This has happened three times in the last week.
I've also noticed after a picture, if I turn the cam off and this happens even with a full battery, the lens does not always retract.
I have to 'power-cycle' the camera a few times to get it to retract the lens.
Overall, the camera is fast and does take great photo's but the 'quirks' are quickly adding up.

Another quirk would be that in order to view the pictures in lets say Adobe Photoshop or any other photo editing software I use I first need to covert the pics from using Sony's proprietary format ARW or Sony's (Alpha RAw) format.
This format is default and your pics must be converted to another format after the fact.
This is not impossible, it just adds another step in the processing and is a little annoying.
The software is free and can be easily downloaded and installed from Sony's site on the off chance you wish to test this out before purchasing your camera.
An example of why this is annoying.
In order to upload example photo's for this review, I first had to cover them to JPEG.
I will say, however, when uploading for google photos I did NOT need to covert them.
Whats up Amazon?
Good camera.
Poor me.
Ahah ahah.
Easy to use.
My wife like it
You would expect it will last longer than 1.5 years when you paid $600+ for a camera.
Mine prompted 'Camera Error Turn Power Off Then On' in the middle of vacation and never recover and Sony wants me to pay $200+ to send it for diagnostic minus the parts & labor.
Looks like I will never buy Sony ever again and I will make sure all my friends & families stay out of SONY.
Stay away or you might have to buy extended warranty for this crappy product.

Review.author: ImmortalJeremy

Text.text: Thatâ€™s what I said within seconds of using this camera.
I came from a dedicated camcorder that cost me $1,000.
Sold it and bought this and the 50mm 1.8 from Sony.
Best decision ever.
The 1080p looks almost like 4K because of the large sensor size and downsampling.
Pictures are crisp and it has many pro level features in an affordable package.
My only regret is not buying a 6500 for 4K and less overheating.
Iâ€™ve had this camera overheat at the worst of times but overall it never killed my final product.
As long as youâ€™re prepared with a b cam, itâ€™s not a huge deal breaker.
Never has overheated from photos, even full speed.
Only once you record 50mbps video for about 15 minutes in sunlight or 20 minutes indoors.
Screen out battery door open you may can squeeze a couple more seconds, but it doesnâ€™t solve it for good.
Hooked up to an external recorder does solve the issue it seems.
I do hope Sony includes a micro fan in any future models in this line that cuts on when the temp warning comes on.
Wouldnâ€™t even matter if it made a little noise.
Overall though, this was a GREAT buy and this camera made me switch from canon.
My wife has a T5 and it doesnâ€™t even compete, even with similar lenses despite being a similar price.

Review.author: sail4life
Review.title: So glad i switched to Mirrorless

Text.text: I was a little nervous about switching from a dslr but once I did I am glad.Believe it or not there was a learning curving going to mirrorless.
But the size and weight is a big difference from my Nikon D5000.
Only thing I do not love is the sttap and will probably switch to a new lense.
Lastlythe eye piece is sensitive if your finger is by it thwn it will turn of the lcd screen thinking your using the eye piece.
The camera body works great, and the image quality is quite good for a kit lens.. however.. my kit lens came, apparently, with some imperfections in it.
when I use apertures f22 or above some dots start to show up in my photos.
I thought it was dust so I cleaned up my lens but, these dots won't come off, it really looks like there are some imperfections inside my lens.
I'd give this camera 5 stars but having these dots in my pictures is really disappointing, for $700 i was expecting better quality control.
I like the camera itself.
However, after a few weeks of light use one of the dials stopped working on the top.
It was still under warranty so Sony told me to send it to Precision Camera to get fixed.
Ten days passed and I received my camera back and the defect was still present.
It's a fairly obvious defect so it appears that no one at PC verified that it was fixed.
Sony had me send the camera back to PC to get it fixed again.
This time I included detailed instructions on how to reproduce the issue.
Ten days more days pass, I receive the camera back and it's still broken.
I call Sony yet again and they tell me they will send me a new camera but they need me to send it back to PC as a formality.
This is almost 6 weeks since I initially sent it in for repairs.
Now I find out that the camera is being shipped back to me and is 'Fixed'.
I bought this camera to to take pix of our newborn and have missed a month and a half of priceless memories because of this abysmal customer service.
Nice camera.
sent it back the battery life was horrible.....
Excellent camera.
Super light and focuses fast.
Don't buy this camera.
It will break, and Sony customer service is of zero help, even though the camera is 6 moths old and under warranty.
If there was a zero star rating, that's what their camera service deserves.

I love

Review.author: Debbie Reid

I am looking at the Sony FDXR53 which I think I would really like but now I'm kind of afraid to buy Sony because of the over heat problem with this camera.

Review.author: GO FOR IT
Review.title: Very compact and the image quality seems to be quite good. Will update in a month

Text.text: Just got my hands on it.
Very compact and the image quality seems to be quite good.
Will update in a month.
Camera was delivered a day earlier than promised.
It works great and there are many features to learn about.
Great, great camera.
I won't go into the good things since others have already done that quite well.
My small complaints are with the menu system, the sound quality and the shutter noise.
The menu system is manageable if you have loads of time to find things, but in a hurry its difficult to find the exact mode and setting changes.
The audio quality is not good.
The equalization is very thin and tinny.
And the slightest wind negatively affects the sound.
I take a lot of 5-10 min videos where the camera is stationary and just captures the ambiance of the location, e.g., beach, mountains, travel, etc.
The wind noise is terrible.
I've tried the mic attachment; while its better, its a headache to attach.
Given all the high-quality audio recorders out there (even my iPhone records better audio), Sony should have better audio at this point.
And the shutter noise...
I know the design of a mirrorless camera usually means there will be a physical shutter noise, but its loud.
Taking silent pictures of animals, children, speaker presentations, etc, is almost impossible without everyone hearing you.
When my iPhone can take silent pictures, the technology on mirrorless has to match it.

Review.author: Dylan Timov
Review.title: Disappointed with the White Balance and the software

Text.text: I bought the camera in February and noticed there is an issue with the white balance.

It was $367.29 and didn't know that I should expect an issue with the camera, however when I was taking my first photographs I noticed that the image is very blueish and I always have to edit it afterwards, which shouldn't be an issue with a $700 camera.
This happens in AWB mode and to prove this, I went to BestBuy and B&H in NYC to compare it with an A6000 there and they confirmed that the camera has a major issue with the white balance.
I could clearly see the temperature on my camera was way blueish than the A6000 in B&H.
It's very disappointing to know that I now have to pay for a repair (possibly around $200) and my favorite camera is faulty, which wasn't explained in the description at the time of purchase.
Bought it for a friend who takes it everywhere - it's a workhorse.

Review.author: M. Harmison
Review.title: Great camera for everyday use and travel

Text.text: I've been very happy with this camera.
I only wish it had a GPS encoding feature.
We got it for our trip to Australia and New Zealand and took thousands of pictures over the course of a month.
I love the light weight and small size.
I use a wrist strap instead of a neck strap and that is very handy.
Battery life was fine, but I did buy some extra batteries and needed one when we were out all day.
The features available are amazing, but it is still easy to use.
I will be mastering it for months more to come.
There are some great tutorials on the web and I'd encourage you to watch them.
I've had this camera for about 9 months now and although not perfect, I love it!
I use mine for backpacking and astrophotography.
It is good and convenient to carry.
Great camera.
Better performance than my previous NEX6.
Easy to use....takes amazingly clear pictures.
Love it !
Take good picture
Before you buy this camera, be aware Sony's photo and video down loader (PlayMemories Home) to your computer DOES NOT WORK if you have a Microsoft computer with operating system 10.
I've been trying for 2 days now to get mine to work, ever since Microsoft updated my computer!
Talked to their representatives in the Philippines and the last person I talked to today admitted they are having problems with PlayMemories Home.
It will NOT work, so you will have to find some way other than using PlayMemories Home to download your pics & vids from your camera to your computer.
I like the camera, but Sony isn't concerned about the problem I'm having.
One of the Philippino reps was so rude, I had to tell her good bye as she kept typing and was not helping me with the issue I presented her with.
for the price this is a phenomenal camera
With everything that has been said about this camera, it is becoming pointless to rave further, especially now that Sony has announced its successor, the a6300.
But I will say that as a Sony Alpha 900 user, pining for mirrorless but reluctant to 'step down' to an APS-C sensor, I was immediately blown away by this camera.
The image quality is actually better than that of my old Alpha 900 (R.I.P.).
It has similar resolution, but better low light capability, better color, and better noise.
Yes, even the noise - when you can see it - is better!
Softer, rounder, more natural.
Seeing such beautiful images come from such a small camera has rekindled my passion for photography.
So if you are tempted by mirrorless, reluctant to move from full-frame to crop sensor, but can't afford an A7 - then I recommend going for the a6000 or its successor the a6300.
Their small size, incredible auto-focus, and after-market versatility make these little cameras a joy to use, and with image quality that can scarcely be believed.

Review.author: Blackhorse
Review.title: Astonishing competency for the investment cost...and way fun!

Text.text: My fourth digital camera over the years, obviously the most completely competent.
I mean, it is stunningly good at doing things that we had no idea we had to have even five years ago.
You're reading this because you're thinking of buying one?
In your search for info you should go to U Tube and search under the camera name...TONS of top of the line pro reviews, etc.
Some are a pain to watch but most are very good.
I'll stress keeping 'what is right for your specific intended uses' as what should be your underlying mantra while doing your pre purchase research.
For me...vacation/travel/family/image quality/value for investment/use of old lenses...were what was most important.
I got the silver body and kit lens, a nice bag, Wasabi charger and 2 batteries and an extra Sony 32 GB fast memory card for a stunning $550 just after New Year.
The camera is rated as best in class for a wide variety of functions and 'as good as' on most others...up against darn near anything.
Often out does current gear costing 3 - 4 times as much.
Jack of all trades...master of a bunch as well.
Example: I have an OLD Olympus 50mm f1.2 prime and a classic Vivitar 70-200mm zoom of incredible quality...and I can use them via a $25 adaptor.
And they work WELL thanks to several of the a6000's unique focusing features making the required manual focus thing do-able.
I started out in the 70's with the fabulous Olympus Pen FT half frame I carried all over Viet Nam in my cargo pocket.
A roll of 36 got me 72 shots.
The lens was about 38-40mm f 1.2 as I recall...a stunner for resolution.
Now we do digital with Light room and memory cards and sensors and mega pixels and whatnot.
What a wonderful world.
And in that world there are very few cameras that will do that this camera does especially when it has good glass on it.
As a well rounded, vastly usable, bang for the buck camera, IMHO it's the king.
Great camera and kit lenses.
Love this camera.
Great response.
Great features.
Definitely recommended.
If ever there was a physical embodiment of the word 'compromise,' it would be the a6000.
When I saw that the 55-210 bundle was on sale for Christmas of 2015, I made the impulsive decision to sell all my Canon DSLR gear and jump ship for Sony mirrorless.
I think I wanted something fresh and new.
And in that regard, the a6000 certainly delivers.
Before I go any further, I'll say that I'm actually returning the camera, but not because it isn't great.
Sony is rumored to be releasing the follow-up to the a6000 in the coming months, and I'm hoping that it addresses some of my concerns.

Text.text: Sony is no longer a quality brand name.

It broke after 2 years (used a couple of times a year for vacation).

The EVF finder stop working, and the camera heats up and the battery is drained if you leave it on for more than a few minutes, so now I have to constantly switch it off after every a couple of shots.
But the EVF remains dead unless you let it cool and then reset (reboot) the camera - it would then work until you leave the camera on for too long, then the whole problem starts again.
Sony is expensive and extremely unreliable, so now I stay away from Sony cameras.
Exactly what I was expecting!

I had second thoughts after placing the order, but before it had been shipped.
I tried to reach someone to ask about adding the zoom lens as well since I realized it was a bargain at only an additional $150 added to the package.

I could not reach anyone that spoke English well enough to understand my problem and my question, 'Was it an option to still add the zoom lens to the package and pay the difference for the upgraded package since that was a different package offered at the time I ordered it.'
After some explaining, I was afraid my current package was going to be canceled so I ended up stressing that the package I ordered was fine and I wanted no changes.
A little disappointing but the camera was in good shape and I think I will be very happy with it once I have had the opportunity to use it more.
The basic lens really has very little zoom so be aware of this if you order it.
My issue was more with the Amazon order modifying process than the actual item being reviewed.
Love, Love, LOVE!

He said that the Sony would be a lot lighter for me to carry around and it would give me about the same quality of photos as the Canon or Nikon.
Having had my NEX 5 N for 3 years, the a6000 is a definitely worthy upgrade.
The body feels more sturdy and higher quality built.
The build-in flash is usable, and can come in handy in quick shots.
Since the camera has OSS, now all of the NEX5 lenses are actually stabilized.
This is my favorite travel camera now.
Compact and high quality, with semi professional settings including long exposure and easily adjustable P/S/A/M modes.
Loved it!

Review.title: Awesome camera, super fast Auto Focus

Text.text: This camera takes amazing pictures, very sharp and professional quality images.
One of the best, for portrait and action photography.
I switched from a Canon DSLR camera due to its bulky size.
I was nervous about the results, but this camera exceeds my expectations, takes better and sharper images than most DSLR.
Easy to use, excellent images, I really like this camera.
For me the size is right - large enough to hold, enough spacing between buttons that you don't press 2 at once, yet much smaller than the DSLR form factor.
Two minor quibbles - the lens release button is hard to access because it is positioned between the lens and the camera's handgrip.
And, the plastic cover around the viewfinder is not friendly to those who wear glasses.
It needs to be larger and made of a more compliant material.
As it is, in bright sun, you get a lot of light in-between your glasses and the viewfinder.
Otherwise, a great choice for anyone looking at mirrorless cameras.
I'm only giving this product three stars at this time.
That's because the kit I received had a defective lens, and I wasn't able to really take any pictures with it.
Everything that I've read would leave me to believe that this is a great camera though.
Perfect !

Review.author: Chris Protopapas
Review.title: Very nice little camera, capable of excellent image quality, but poor battery life.

Text.text: A very nice little camera.
Small, lightweight but feature-packed, it's an impressive package.
The APC image format is equal to most consumer DSLR cameras, and it shoots RAW files, so this is a serious camera.
Image quality up to 2500 ISO is excellent, and above that the inevitable noise is not too objectionable, reminding me somewhat of fast negative film grain rather than digital noise.
The standard 16~55mm lens is very good for a kit lens, and gives somewhat wider coverage (equivalent to a 24mm lens on full-frame cameras) than usually found on these types of lenses.
Distortion at the wider angles is serious, but if you shoot RAW it's easily corrected during processing.

It will feel small and the controls will feel a bit crowded if you're used to a DSLR, but everything becomes second nature in no time.

I cant imagine that sony after all their products do such a silly mistake, that the hook of the shoulder strap is made of metal ( not coated), and is attached to another not coated metal part, yes it is strong but ruined all videos taken because f the noise of the metals together, the two sides are the same , every slightest movement caused that noise and is recorded and is very very loud when you watch the video!
this reason is enough for me to return the camera .
At last Sony has improved & simplified the settings and usefulness of menus.

Nevertheless, if the NEX7 is too complicated this is the current answer.

There is no adequate documentation to assist one in learning the cameras many features.
Without a reasonable manual the learning curve is going to be steep and lengthy with many lost opportunities.
I am sort of willing to spend some time learning how to used the camera to the best of its features but in hindsight probably would not have purchased it.

Review.author: Toddy Surcharge
Review.title: I bought this from Best Buy about a month ago and wanted to review ...

Text.text: I bought this from Best Buy about a month ago and wanted to review it after using it for a bit.
All I can say is that this camera is a lot of fun.
I own a Sigma DP1 Merrill, a Nikon D3300, Nikon D500 and a Nikon D800E...so I have taken a lot of pictures on Nikons using both crop and full frame sensors.
This was my first experience with a Sony product that wasn't a Playstation, it was very pleasant.
I downloaded a few of the 'apps' that Sony offers (at a price) on their Alpha lines; Double Exposure, Smooth Reflection and Motion Shot.
Took the camera with the 2 kit lenses (16-50) and (50-200) and journeyed to a trail a few minutes away from my house.
I attached the pictures I got using these three apps as well as a cool in camera 'watercolor' filter effect.
So Iâ€™ve had the A6000 for about a year now and I could not be happier.
The strong points for this camera are auto focus and shutter speed especially on burst mode.
Awesome for action shots when in good light.
It does fall a little short on low light but it is an aps-c sensor not to say itâ€™s bad but nowhere near a full frame.
Would definitely recommend to someone looking to get a good quality camera for stills and video!

Sony has put a lot of thought into the user interface and the intelligence with which the camera operates in auto mode is a thing of beauty.
The one knock against this camera keeping it from 5 stars is that video in low light is pretty much impossible.
Video from my son's musical in an auditorium had to be deleted due to poor quality.
I am very satisfied with the purchase based on the quality of photos it takes, the construction, and the thought that Sony put into making an infinetly usable camera.
I love this camera!!

This is a wonderful camera.

However, if you take your time to learn the camera you will be rewarded.

With the proper settings of shutter speed, ISO, and aperture it gives great pictures.
I use aperture control the majority of the time since I like to control DOF.
I purchased a Sigma 19mm F2.8 lens and it works nicely for most of my needs.
Works nicely for low light to sunny landscapes.
My previous experience is with the big DSLRs so this camera is like a sports car compared to them.
Can't say enough.....meets my photo needs.
A winner for me with no buyers remorse.
Highly recommended.

Excellent product

Great camera worth every penny.
Bought this as a gift for my girlfriend to use on our vacations and it's been great so far.
Price was by far cheaper on amazon than at target and came with accessories.
At $400 for the body, this is my 3rd and most serious venture into mirrorless.
There's not much to say about this marvel, after more than a year on the market and many favorable reviews.
While not perfect, it's feature-packed and known for good still and video with fast focus, low noise, and good dynamic range.
I think this remains one of the best values in the digital mirrorless interchangeable lens market, even offering some features not yet found in the newer Sony FF models.
It's got a fast EVF with very little lag I can notice.
Mine shipped with the v2.00 firmware, which I think is the latest, and which also adds the newer 'XAVC S' video format that is more efficient.
It charges via USB and an external charger is optional.
Drawing about 1.5A initially, and peaking at almost 2A 1.5 hours later (2193 mAh), mine charged to more than 90% in about 2.3 hours, to about 99% in 2.5 hours (2300 mAh).
I got the $200 Sigma 30mm f2.8 DN prime lens (Sony E) as my first lens, after seeing the Lavikka Photography review on YouTube.
They say the battery will not nearly last a day of heavy shooting, so be prepared.
Excellent camera and the deal was so excellent.
I am quite impressed with the photos.
I love the lightness of the camera.
Plan on taking it out on walks and trips.
I own a larger DSLR and it gets heavy when I am out walking around.
This is my second Sony a6000.
It is an amazing camera.
I'm hopeful that a newer version will soon appear and I can have both.
I carried one of these around Europe last year and came back with hundreds of very good images.
Never pushed the limits with the previous one.
I never tried the facial recognition and eye focus, for example.
But I will now.
My only complaint is that Sony chose not to include a 3.5 mm microphone jack.
The only microphones input is through the multi-interface-shoe and it doesn't work well.
But for still photography it is a great camera and the video itself is good.
I really didn't get much time to use this camera as I am returning it.
The reason...the shutter noise is *very* loud and there's no real way to silence it.
I photograph live performances in theaters and the volume of this camera is not acceptable in single shot or burst mode.
If volume is not an issue for you, please still consider this camera.
I absolutely love this camera.
It has a very old-school 35mm feel to it (the weight balance is very satisfying), but an incredible range of modern functionality.
I also appreciate that it does not look flashy or obvious, which is ideal for staying low-key.
I would give this a 4.8 out of 5.
The camera can be a bit cumbersome to use due to the plethora of settings and options.
However, it takes phenomenal pictures.
I'm a complete amateur at photography (just started 2 weeks ago) and I already got the hang of this camera so don't be intimidated.
I recommend Tony Northrup's camera tutorial on YouTube as it will help you tremendously.
Forget your bulky DSLR and switch to mirror-less!

Review.author: DarkWater13
Review.title: Perfect Example of 'Good Things Come in Small Packages'

Text.text: Looking at the trade-offs between cost, size, and performance, it might be impossible to beat this camera.
You can accomplish most of what you can with a much larger DSLR in a very small package, and at a decent price.
Image quality is great and there are a lot of lens options.
When shooting in continuous mode, the maximum 11 FPS is really amazing even when compared to much more expensive cameras.
Hauling around a DSLR isn't always the most attractive option and this camera is a great alternative.
Far more noisy than I first expected!
Great camera with functions that most users may find tough to get used to.
I purchased this camera to fit between my bulky Nikon D750 and a point and shoot Panasonic LX10.
Larger sensor, more software features, etc.
than the LX10 but only slightly more bulk.
Added a 20mm pancake Sony lens, so I'm $800 into the whole thing.
Problem is, image quality is worse than the smaller, cheaper LX10 and the software makes the camera unusable at night, when I take most shots.
Just one example of many, the info provided on bulb shots is always 30 seconds, regardless of the length of the shot.
I could go on and on, but the point is, this camera does not perform as well as cheaper, lighter, smaller cameras.
Unfortunately, I threw away the packaging, so I now own a $800 camera that I will never use.
Good value in a camera, great automatic functions for amateurs looking for great photos but just enough quality for high level photography.

Review.author: Gabian

Text.text: I gave tree stars for material because I did not find in the package the AC adaptor as well as the body cap.
Perhaps because I bought through Amazon Warehouse but it was not highlighted at all in the description
The function and form of this camera more than make-up for the fact that I was sent a used camera.
Upon opening the box I was immediately struck by the fact all the little bags that the various pieces were in had clearly been opened.
When I inspected the camera there wasn't any protective film on the screen and there were a couple of large finger smudges on the display.
When I fired the camera up it was not in the factory default settings.
I shoulda known better and got this where i can inspect the product before purchase.
for astrophotography is a good entry level camera, tales great photos, the menu system it is not intuitive.
Worth every penny
Great little camera.
Light weight but full of performance.
Was worried for a bit.
Screen would go black when I would shoot vertical.
Realized there was a sensor I was covering that activated the viewfinder and turned off the screen.
Would recommend to anyone wanting a small camera wirh full dslr capabilities.

Review.author: Karen Viel
Review.title: I love that this is a lightweight and smaller camera

Text.text: I love that this is a lightweight and smaller camera.
It takes great pictures (the not so great ones are due to operator error).
WOW great camera, but expensive lens...........

Review.author: AudioGuyDMB
Review.title: Awesome tool for casual photography and advanced photography alike

Text.text: Love this camera.
It allows the user to get as involved as they want.
Use it as a point and shoot and you'll get some great pictures.
Learn a little bit about photography and put in some effort, and this camera will reward you in spades.
The more effort/time I put into learning how to use this camera (and the physics behind photography in general), the better my pictures get.

It's a rewarding feeling having a piece of equipment advanced enough to let me develop my skills, while still being able to produce some great pictures when I'm feeling lazy and just want to shoot away.

Review.author: Edisom Kamphorst
Review.title: but for photography it's much better than Nikon and Canon at same price

Text.text: It heats for the video, but for photography it's much better than Nikon and Canon at same price.
11 shots for second, so good.
And I had a 12800 ISO bride's portrait in a double page at my album.
Can you imagine that with a t5i?

Review.author: Alfredo Conejo
Review.title: The camera was not new at all. This is ...

Text.text: The camera was not new at all.
This is not acceptable, the screen had scratches all over the screen and in the backside of the screen there were sticky places which makes me thinks that this was used by someone else.
Great value for the money.
If your not a photographer but still want quality DLSR without the bulk.
This is a fantastic camera.
Night time pics are great, just make sure to use a tripod or have very steady hands.

Review.author: Jim
Review.title: The camera is working fine so far

Text.text: The camera is working fine so far.
I love this camera.
I took this on my trip to Europe and it took amazing pictures and was super nice and compact!
I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone traveling or just looking for a nice light camera that takes pretty good pictures

Review.author: Matt
Review.title: **CAUTION** I received this item only to tear away the ...

Text.text: I loooooove this camera!
So easy to use.
Even the automatical photos look gorgeous, with beautiful color and depth.
Can't wait to take a lesson and learn about its additional features.
Very portable (for a camera with a removable lens).
Happy I decided to go with the package with two lenses.

Review.author: J. Stewart
Review.title: Grear product for an on-the-go person

Text.text: If you're not overly into tech, but want to take nice pictures, this does the job well.
My girlfriend really likes it, and it is a lot easier to use than my larger DSLR.
The quality of photos shines, it focuses quickly, and action shots stay in focus really reall well.
A must with our active kids.
Came brand new!
Nice small size, fits your hands.
A lot of features Canon doesn't have, like the Sony Memories App.
Being able to shoot with your iphone / Android device
This is a revision of my 3 star review a month ago.
The camera had stopped responding to its controls on the A, S, P mode settings, after only 3 weeks.
Thanks to the SONY customer service website I learned how to re-initialize the camera ( a menu item) and restore full function.
Been good ever since.
The built-in flash is weak, but anyone taking indoor pictures should use a buy a flash unit that tilts, swivels, diffuses, anyway.
My only criticism is that the power zoom lever is too easy to accidentally hit, sending the lens flying toward wide-angle.
That minor concern aside, this camera has helped me accomplish a wide variety of photo tasks in the last 30 days, with the standard 16-50 lens, and has performed very acceptably throughout.
If you want to stay under $1,000.00, this camera will not disappoint.
Your can even add another lens, a decent flash unit and a UV filter and stay at that cost.
One great feature deserves a special mention.
That is this camera's speedy auto focus.
No more 'lost moments' while waiting for poky focusing.
Kudos to Sony for that one.
Amazing Camera.
especially for new photographers
Love this camera!
I bought it for my trip to Israel and was able to take some great photos with very minimal editing on Lightroom.
Both lenses are good for the price, though I find myself using the kit lens more than the zoom lens.
I have Tiffen UV filters (clear) on both lenses, and the camera is compatible with lots of different camera bags, tripods, and other accessories that are available at a wide range of prices.
Camera no longer recognizes 16-50 lens which came with camera
This camera is amazing.
I had a Canon T3i and wanted a T6i until I ran into this thing.

Review.author: Marsha Mccollum
Review.title: I am in the process of becoming a purchase also but by me being on a fixed income it is hard to get this wonderful camera eventually I will get one but until then ...

Text.text: My son purchased this Sony a6000 and he loves it.

I am in the process of becoming a purchase also but by me being on a fixed income it is hard to get this wonderful camera eventually I will get one but until then I love this camera it is light weight and very user friendly.
Excellent product and service
Lightweight and easy to operate.
This is a great camera.
Last week I went on a shoot with my Camera Club and there were four of us with the same Sony a6000 camera.
Several of us had exchanged our heavier cameras for the a6000.
I also ordered the QuickPro Camera Guide which helps with an indepth understanding of the camera.

Review.author: Renee Cocchi
Review.title: This camera is amazing! It's the best camera I've ever owned

Text.text: This camera is amazing!
It's the best camera I've ever owned.
My daughter is a dancer and it catches her in motion perfectly!
Amazing camera well it is at least for me.
Bought this as my starter camera and ive been using it for about 2 weeks and I really like it.
I cant really compare it to any other cameras since its my first but its small, light weight and takes nicer pics than my cell phone camera.
It also receives a lot of compliments everywhere I take it out.
I uploaded a couple pictures I took using auto mode, I havent really had any time to try to learn how to shoot using the other settings.
Only thing that i do not like is the battery life but I bought a couple of spares for $20 and that works for me.
Completely happy with this camera.
Seems to be well built.
Great pictures with amazing auto-focus!

Review.author: Jack
Review.title: It was doing just fine till a 'friend' backed off a bridge into the ...

Text.text: It was doing just fine till a 'friend' backed off a bridge into the Colorado River.
She went to the hospital, the camera went to the trash.

very nice features - 11 frames per second, in camera HDR, lightweight and compact, facial recognition, awesome low light capabilities, very easy to use with no getting frustrated as i toggle between ISO, F-stops, and shutter speed.
Would like a higher flash sync of 1/200 sec instead of 1/160th.
Good update to Nex 7, though the build quality isn't nearly as good, solid, reliable feeling.
Focuses faster, better menu layout, but sometimes I wonder if the Nex 7 wouldn't have been plenty adequate.
Thing is, I like to get bird images and have the new Sony 70-200 for travel, when Canon mega-zoom is just too damn big.
So the A6000 makes the lens a 300/f4--not as functional as my 540mm equivalent Canon, but good enough when keeping things light, especially with 24mp for cropping.
Anyway, birds rarely stay still, so I figured if I'm going to use it for that purpose I need to upgrade from the Nex 7 for faster focus, so I did.

But...I LOVE the Nex 7, love it's images, it's metal-based build quality, it's feel of solidity and reliability, and BTW I love its electronic level, which this one inexplicably lacks....and so I'm keeping at least one Nex 7 body, because otherwise I feel like I'll have lost something in the bargain.
So...clearly I'm conflicted, though I'll be keeping this camera, mainly for the birds.

Review.author: alicia loveland
Review.title: The best camera I have ever owned.

Text.text: It has so many options that I need a week just to try them all.
I love the mirrorless part of it because it snaps so fast and it is awesome that the panoramic option also stitches the pictures together for one picture.
Cool camera, expensive tag, if your a casual photographer, stick with the smartphones because they still make good photos.

Review.author: Thurston Howell III
Review.title: Unreal images from a small package- dump your DSLR

Text.text: I'm a bit neurotic about big ticket items, so I research and try lots of things before I'm happy.
After trying out the Lumix, LX100, Fuji Xt1, Canon D5500, Ricoh GR, Lumix LX7 and Sony RX100, I've found a camera that I'm happy with.
In spades.
I should have purchased it up front with the retractable lens.
I didnâ€™t read it well enough I guess.
I used this camera for one week on vacation then packed it away.
When I went to use it again I got the 'cannot recognize lens error'.
After some googling, I found this to be very common.
I tried all of the tricks that were suggested but it still isn't working.
They want a minimum of $240 to fix it.
What a waste of money.

Review.author: Monique F.
Review.title: Amazing camera, even for noobs like me!

Text.text: Worth the money.
I'm an amateur photographer but this thing makes me feel like a pro!
I can't wait to buy another lens!
I highly recommend buying a Think Tank Mirrorless Mover camera bag so you can store everything in one place.
Also necessary for those just starting out is a separate battery charger pack with two back-up batteries - worth it and it even comes with European adaptor -
Great mirrorless camera.
Was able to use it almost immediately - very easy to set up.
Will be spending a lot of time to learn it thoroughly, but am able to point and shoot on auto right out of the box.
Very nice pictures without much effort.

Review.author: Noname Norelation
Review.title: The camera that honestly does it all

Text.text: I purchased the a6000 to begin building a new photo system.
Iâ€™ve had 3 great Canon DSLRs and never put much money in to the lenses, so I didnâ€™t feel trapped in Canon land.
Iâ€™ve used many different systems besides what Iâ€™ve owned, donâ€™t call myself a â€œproâ€ although photography has been a source of income in my life.
Basically, I know what Iâ€™m doing...ok?
I had a budget of about $2,000 which could get me any of the latest Canons or Nikons, and I chose this little inexpensive machine.

A near perfect camera system combining the features of portability, use-ability, quality of design engineering, quality of build, quality of photographic result, and in the case of the A6000, very good value also.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: but this one has made it really easy to get into

Text.text: I am a novice with cameras, but this one has made it really easy to get into.
Great features, quick focus, and hassle-free controls make it a nice first camera.
The only drawback for me (and it wouldn't be for someone with more experience ) is the lack of zoom.
You really need to purchase a separate lens for close ups if you plan on using it for sports and other performances.
Other then that it has been an awesome camera.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Pretty disappointed to say the least

Text.text: The camera took a month to arrive, and when it did, the box had already been opened and the camera put together.
All the cords were opened and unwrapped as well.
When I switched the camera on, the lens made a strange noise and then a message came on the screen saying that the lens was not connected properly.
I reattached the lens multiple times with it clicking firmly into place and it still was not working.
Pretty disappointed to say the least.
I promptly returned it.

Review.author: N. Harris
Review.title: Camera Error. Turn power off then on...

Text.text: Nice while it worked, but now its worthless with the infuriating message 'Camera Error.
Turn power off then on.'
Yep, I tried that and about 100 other suggestions from the thousands of other a6000 owners who experienced the same thing.
Still the same unfixable error message.
And Sony wants hundreds of $$$$ and several months to fix it.
The a6000 was my first and will be my last Sony camera.

Review.author: Gregory Kats
Review.title: Excellent Camera, with lots of capabilities

Text.text: Excellent Camera, with lots of capabilities.
However, you have to spend a week, studying all of them.

Review.author: Caymen
Review.title: Traded in my canon 70D for this

Text.text: AMAZING camera for the price.
It's is full of features and is a good camera for intermidate to experienced photographers and videographers.
The video codec options are great and the 24.3 megapixel sensor is as sharp as a razor.
Pair this up with a G master lens and you'll get images almost as sharp as a 5D mark 3!
I always liked this camera, but for vloggers the RX100 Mark V is better in general.
So far I just love this little sucker.
Coming from a Nikon d7000 I feel like I'm holding a phone.
The size is why I got it.
I'm just a hobbyist looking for a good image.
This camera fits that.
The focus speed on it is just amazing.
I can walk along and stop for an brief moment and get a image that's focus is perfect.
I recommend this camera to anyone and even more so for those people who love the outdoors.
This camera has exceeded my expectations.
I have owned several SLR cameras before this and I cannot believe a camera so light and small can perform so well.
There are a lot of features I have still not figured out how to use, but it is easy to experiment with and learn.
The picture quality is outstanding.
Love this camera.
Nice pictures.
Very portable.
Even my mom can use it -- No more headless family images.
Lightweight, modular, great point-and-shoot mechanics with DSLR quality.
It's low light capabilities are impressive, thoroughly tested while exploring the beautiful temples and monasteriesâ€‹ around Shanghai and Beijing.

Review.author: Mitchell
Review.title: Amazing Camera for an Amateur for Under $700

Text.text: In advance, excuse my long-winded review.
Nice pic.
Work well
It's awesome Camara
I was looking for a nice camera to travel and start taking amateur photos with.
At first I was looking at the usual mid range Canon and Nikon DSLRs but I came across this and it was exactly what I wanted.
I read up on this camera for a few days before deciding to buy it and I couldn't be more satisfied with my purchase.
The A6000 is a very good camera that has many features, is easy to navigate, and isn't as bulky of a camera as a DSLR to carry around.
There are also a wide variety of lenses to choose from.
Wonderful camera bundle for the price.
I like all the features and the pictures look great.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: This is a fantastic camera. You can't beat it for it's size

Text.text: This is a fantastic camera.
You can't beat it for it's size, though you should note that E mount lenses are few in number still and tend to be fairly expensive.
wonderful camera
Good value for money camera.
Good photos.
The only issue I had is that I ordered silver and it came black.
Great product
Love this camera.
I took it to Iceland and Norway and it lived up to its expectation.
Well built, great quality images at a bargain price.
Great for my intension of using it for my personal blogging.
Highly recommend.

Review.author: TopCat
Review.title: Great camera, Can do a lot of what professional ...

Text.text: Great camera, Can do a lot of what professional cameras can do, at a fraction of the cost.
A real bargain compared to the 63000 and 6500, if you don't need those features.
So far so good.
Still learning but it will be very good when I get it all figured out.
Love the very fast focus, excellent low light performance, light weight handling, great VET and all the other great features.
Its does everything that Nikon and Canon can already do (electronically), and more!
I'm still learning it, and it seems to work better in the P mode and in AF-C mode, set on the 'wide-area' for the Autofocus.
I've tried the P mode on my 2 Sony 18.2 MP small pocket-size, point and shoots, with not much luck.
The P mode works very well on the a6000.
The Gary Fong (free on Youtube) videos have been very helpful to me, to understand how to use it.
It has the Nikon style 'eye-auto' focus, which I still need to learn.
I understand that you'll have to program it, and then hold the AEL and shutter together, to get that feature to work.
Still a great camera despite the a6300 release
Camera takes absolutely amazing photos.
I love that the camera has both point & shoot and manual adjustment capabilities.
It's also rather small (not fit in your pocket small) so it's great to travel with.
It was in excellent condition ( used ) ......... very happy.
Great travel camera.
Takes amazing landscapes, astrophotos, long exposure - everything.
I have problems getting the focus to lock on when taking pictures of birds in flight or fast-action sports.
It has plenty of speed, but most action shots are not keepers.
Also, I wish there were more lenses available.

Review.author: Manny
Review.title: After a year still loving it!

Text.text: I am writing this review after owning the Sony a6000 for a year I have done many types of photography with it, from weddings and portraits to street photography in Europe and nature in American national parks.
It has worked well for every one of these applications.
Yes the battery life isn't very good but you can buy after market batteries like wasabi for cheap and it is not hard to carry a 4 or 5 extra batteries because they are so small.
I am coming from shooting Canon for 12 years have had every level of their cameras and this Sony is my favorite camera I have owned so far.
I love the portability and image quality of this camera.
I have four lens for this camera a Sony 10-18mm oss, 18-105mm oss, and two sigma's 30mm f/2.8 and 60mm f/2.8.

As I write this Sony has come two more versions of this camera the a6300 and the a6500 both are have a lot of great features and they come with a higher price tag, for now I am totally satisfied with the a6000.
I highly recommend this camera.
A great camera at a great price.
So many features and lens options.
You will not be disappointed.
Great camera.
A few drawbacks I want to address, aside from those this camera is awesome.
The Sony Cybershot with the Carl Zeiss lens is my favorite point and shoot, and this is hands down one of my favorite DSLRs ever.
The rapid fire action shot works very well.
The a6500 compared to the a7ii and the 1DX is definitely an up and comer in the top 5 DSLR cameras.
no info on how to use camera
Replaced my full frame Canon Mark II 5D and expensive lenses with this and love it.
The RAW files are better than the Canon and the camera is so lightweight and compact.
I bought elsewhere when price was $800 and now Amazon has that price so grab it while you can.
It's virtually all you need for 95% of all shooting and I'm a retired full time professional photographer.
The two lenses cover almost anything you could need and the shorter lenses does great closeups although not true macro.
Broke not even 2 months after... left speaker doesn't work

Review.author: Minitechnicus
Review.title: Lightning fast camera for passionate photographers

Text.text: A great upgrade for my awesome Nikon D90 DSLR.
It is also everything Sony A5000 wasn't: lighting fast shooting, fast focusing, good low light performance, good viewfinder, very portable.
The only minuses I see are the battery (expected and quite normal for this type of camera) and very expensive E-mount lenses.
For now I rely on the fast and clear E-mount Sigma 30mm prime that works perfectly w/ the camera.
Aloha first off a little about myself for reference, I'm an enthusiast shooter that loves landscapes, cityscapes, and surfphotography.
I also do model and animal photos too occasionally.
I've shot with canon xt/xsi, 7D, 5D, and 5D mrk iii, and now the a6000.
I primarily bought the a6000 for it's very small size and great image quality for quick short trips.
I have it in my backpack all the time and don't even notice it's there.
Being a dslr shooter that loves to control all aspects of the camera, I was worried that I'd be limited to what I'd be able to control.
But the a6000 offers me even more control of the camera than my 5d mrk iii!
I was also worried about getting used to the button layout but it actually is very intuitive, my time spent learning where everything was was very short.
Also the different types of information that you can customize your rear screen with and the evf are incredible!
I previously bought the Sony Nex 3 when it first came out in 2010.
I was happy with that camera and learned a lot about what setting to use with that camera.
It had the best layout, and very good graphics.
I felt it wasn't quite ready to be released, as they had a few firmware updates since then.
It also didn't have enough buttons to program.
I love this camera!!
The picture quality is astounding for such a small camera.
Why lug around a bulky DSLR when you can have the same quality (if not better) in such a small package.
The autofocus is great.
11 frames per sec is phenomenal.

Review.author: Ben
Review.title: and so far I have been nothing less than pleased with itsâ€™ performance

Text.text: If you are new to this type of camera like I was, expect a great experience.
My neighbor who is a photography buff put me on to this as an alternative to a dslr and I'm really glad he did.
Like others, I was looking for a travel camera that would take really good pics and was easy to handle (both size/weight and functions.
This camera is it.
My only suggestion is that you also purchase a book that walks you through all the functions and how to use the camera effectively as what comes with the camera is severely lacking.
I chose David Bush's 'Sony a6000/ILCE-6000 Guide to Digital Photography' and have been impressed.
The lens are OK for the price and there are many others you can add to your bag.
I would highly recommend this camera to my friends.
Love this camera, bought it right before we went to Disney along with a 32gb Lexar class II SD Card.
Both performed above my expectations, from low light conditions to video I was very impressed.

The battery life was better than expected, I was expecting the juice to run out after a few hours of use but I was able to take a couple of hundred pictures every day along with 10 to 20 minutes of video every day without any problems.
I would definitely recommend this camera to anybody.
I only wish they had a string on the lens cap other than that this camera is awesome and outperforms anything else I've ever owned.

Review.author: Max
Review.title: The best camera Ive ever have my last camera was sony ...

Text.text: The best camera Ive ever have my last camera was sony r5 and the A6000 is a lot superior
This camera is great.
I am not a professional but I know quality when I see it.
I am a real estate agent and this camera has made me notorious for the best pictures in the area.
It actually has increased my business.
I like everything about this camera, easy to use, great pictures, great color, good in low light, and quick focus.
A must have-so far I'm getting better all around pictures than my A77II

Review.author: settrack
Review.title: Sony a6000 also has a very good video recording quality

Text.text: Amazing camera,good quality,good features,this Sony a6000 takes amazing photos even in the night.
It firs on hand very comfortable.
The battery life is very good too.I recomend it.
This is my new everyday camera.
I take it with me just about everywhere, which is so easy to do because it is super light, small, and relatively compact.
I'm used to Nikon DSLRs, so for me this little guy is like a compact camera with a DSLR-level sensor in it.
I'm very happy with this camera!
It needs a bigger lens
I've tried to take good pictures with this camera and comparing to my Nikon D3300, picture quality just not as good.
I recommend looking into another camera.

Review.author: Po Tsui
Review.title: Beautiful pictures and great for beginners, but with some annoyances

Text.text: This was my first camera beyond a digital point and shoot; overall, I'm pretty satisfied.
The included lens is enough for my needs of capturing important moments and places I visit.
I especially appreciated its weight and portability, especially considering how powerful and customizable it is.
Photography is my most favorite hobby.
I don't do it professionally nor do I get paid for my work, but I consider myself an enthusiast.
I have invested thousands of dollars in camera gear, lightroom, and photoshop, etc.
and this is THE camera I would take with me whenever I go traveling.
It's lightweight, the battery lasts me all day, and I don't really have to think about adjusting shutter speed and aperture etc.
It's super quick and easy to use, which is what I like and need whenever I go traveling.
The angle is also wide enough to get the most in a picture, and the pictures come our really clear and pigmented.
The kit lens isn't the best for portrait photography if that's what you're looking to do since a 3.0f aperture doesn't provide the best bokeh.
Usually portrait photography is done with aperture below 2.0f for the best results, but those lens definitely cost A LOT.
This camera is great for landscapes and pictures where you want all the details.
It's great for the price too.
Depends on what you need it for, but overall a solid and wonderful camera!
Better than heavy DSLRs.
Easy to use anytime anywhere and quality is great by following proper settings.
I have this along with a canon m50 and gopro6 I have turned out some near professional photo and video.
Definitely a good entry level camera that compares with the more expensive models

Review.author: Colin Lee Blake
Review.title: A Must to have if one loves photography.

Text.text: Bought this to take to New Mexico instead of my Canon SLR.
Well worth the purchase and give great quality pictures.
This is my go-to camera.
I am IN LOVE!!!!!
I have the Sony 55-210 lens and had it all the way zoomed taking pictures of people running and it took clear shots of them!!
Can't believe how fast and clear my shots are coming out.
I love it.
I purchased the Sony a6000 refurbished from Amazon.
The camera itself and lens is in good condition and came with a print out saying it was certified refurbished.
The camera works great and it's pretty easy to use, good for a beginner like me.
It did come with a used battery and some aftermarket charger and USB cable (that didn't work).
I ended up tossing the USB cable because it wouldn't charge the camera and used an old Samsung one that came with my phone.
Everything is working now, however the battery does not hold a charge, which is a common complaint.
There are battery replicas and fakes sold everywhere, so it's hard to find an authentic replacement.
If you purchase the camera new you're in good shape, but don't expect the best quality when you buy refurbished.
Like I said, the camera and lens is fine, but the accessories were junk.
Loved it!

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: looks very nice.. since it is black

Text.text: looks very nice..since it is black.

Review.author: KWS_24
Review.title: Kit lens is quite good quality and the size makes it really convenient to ...

Text.text: So impressed with this camera!
Kit lens is quite good quality and the size makes it really convenient to travel with.
I have been shooting with Canon glass so got the Metabones adapter for my lenses.
Focus tends to take a bit longer and action shots can be a bit challenging but hoping to get some native glass for this unit to realize it's full potential.
Great camera for the price!
I didn't buy my camera on Amazon, sorry but I bought it used.
Anyway, this has been a giant leap ahead compared to my previous bridge camera's.
It does much more and is easier to use, the limiting factor is me.
I am still learning to use the camera.
It can be point and shoot, but to get really good pictures requires a little more, but that applies to any camera.
I love the way it feels in my hands.
Throw in some post processing and many pictures are suitable for framing, which I did.
I just printed a sunset at 24 X 36 and it's wonderful.
Great Camera, more intelligent than I am!
Fun learning all about it
Amazing product, the picture quality is superb, and even the out-of-the-box settings can make you seem semi-professional.
Once you perfect the settings on the camera, you can take professional quality photos (depending on your lens).
We personally like the sigma 2.8 30mm and the sony 1.8 50mm lenses, which give great quality photos for most settings.
The auto-focus feature helps tremendously with capturing our infant son's facial expressions and movements.
The features are a little over-whelming, but once mastered, you'll hardly need to spend any time with enhancing the photos you've taken in lightroom or photoshop.
I included a photo of our baby boy taken with th 1.8 50mm lens using this camera:)
Very good color and low noise due to the large sensor, which is as big as many DSLR cameras.
Many point and shoot cameras have tiny sensors so any underexposed areas tend to be very noisy but not this one.
However, deduct one star due to focus issues.
I routinely take a few hundred photos indoors and outdoors of real estate and sure enough, 2-3% of the photos are out of focus.

Just today I took some and this time, having gotten used to the auto focus quirks, I took multiple shots of critical scenes with identical settings and sure enough, on more than one of them, the scene was out of focus.
And not just a little, but way out of focus.
I have a corded remote and click the shutter button partway until it chirps and shows green.
Then press the rest of the way to take the shot.
Shutter speeds are quick enough that shouldn't be a problem and I'm using a tripod.
Looks good in the viewfinder but when I get home, out of focus.
This seems to happen more often outdoors in complex lighting situations, kind of like it can't figure out what to latch on to.
I've set the auto-focus to use the center of the screen so I know exactly what it is trying to focus on.
Great camera, Takes amazing photo's.
Best Camera
Best camera in the class.
Takes time to master complicated menus.

Review.author: Barton Smith
Review.title: Camera is great, but not all features work

Text.text: I was looking forward to the wireless transfer feature.
It turns out that it does not work on a macbook pro (strangely, it does work on other apple products with the same system).
Sony views this as Apple's fault and suggested I buy a different computer.
That is not the kind of customer service I am looking for.
I upgraded to this camera from an older model, so I was able to use my lenses I already had.
I absolutely LOVE this camera!
If you had a Sony Alpha before- this one will not disappoint.
It has the option to transfer photos to your computer or an app on your phone using wireless connection- which has saved me when I ran out of space on my memory card during a vacation.
It takes beautiful photos and videos.
I also like the new button they added to quickly switch to video or to rotate through the different modes without having to play with the digital screen.
Got this camera and returned it as it was different then the one in the picture.
The one I got is a little larger then the one pictured as well it had a view finder.
This is a model better then the one I had purchased however due to the $120 difference in cost I returned it for the a5100.
These Sony cameras are the best and take the greatest pictures.
I also own a Nikon D5300 with a ton of lenses, Nikon S9500, Canon Point and shoot, and none of them compare to the Sony a5100, in picture quality and ease of use.
The a6000 is a higher quality camera then the model I currently own.
I assume the pictures from it are most likely superior to the lower end model.
The a6000 is a larger camera by a small margin then the a5000 and a5100 and it has a few additional features.
Amazon Warehouse saved hundreds on this purchase.
You cannot go wrong with a Sony Alpha or NEX.

Review.author: Camilo
Review.title: The Good, the Bad the Ugly Support

Text.text: I bought this camera on January 16 through Amazon.
I started to have issues with the screen since I opened it.
I even opened a ticket to return the item to Amazon because I was seeing some weird lines on the screen.

While I was chatting with the support person from Amazon to return the camera, I turned it off for 1 minute and then turned it back on and the lines were gone so I closed the ticket and kept the camera.
This problem has escalated, Now the screen darkens to around 25% of the normal brightness and the lines are very very visible, this happens after around 30 seconds of turning it on.

Review.author: benguild
Review.title: Might ship without body cap. Might arrive with dust or foreign particles on sensor or on inner side of kit lens.

Text.text: This camera is great if you order it without the kit lens.
If you get the kit lens, you're receiving stuff in separate bags with no seals on or between the items.

This is mind-boggling and means that the lens and camera are somewhat open to the air and might have tiny bits of dust or packing material on or attached to them even on arrival as 'new' from the factory.
I bought this camera kit and had this problem, and then a friend did the same and she also had particles attached to the sensor on arrival.

Review.author: **Top Secret**
Review.title: Blows my DSLR out of the water!

Text.text: I am NOT a photographer.
I mean, I take pictures, but they have always been 'point' ... and 'shoot'.
I'm learning photography bit by bit and the Sony A6000 blows both of my DSLR cameras out of the water, every time.
Even though it only cost about half, it delivers 10x the power.
There are so many menu options, it can be overwhelming at first - but really, right out of the box, it's ready to go.
I love both of these lenses for different reasons, and I think the next lens I'll get will either be a 50mm or 35mm.
The one thing I don't like about this camera is that because it's specialized, the price of the lenses is a bit higher than with Canon or Nikon.
However, you can buy an adapter (about $300) and use Canon/Nikon lenses, which is pretty cool.
This camera also does really well with video, and the continuous shooting mode is up to 11 frames per second which is AMAZING!
Definitely worth the cost (and more), and I recommend it to everyone I know!

The 55-210 has proven to be incredible & especially for it's price... you can buy that lens new for $350.
My experience with that lens is excellent and I have shot a lot of high speed shots with the dogs chasing each other at the park.
They look great...also the burst feature is excellent and the AF with this lens is also excellent.
With that being said, the 16-50 Kit lens is unusable.
I actually sent it back and supposedly it was calibrated and cleaned etc..... unusable.
To me it is distorted, unpleasant looking and nothing ever really looks sharp, where the 55-210 looks great.
Of course you can always go buy the 16-70 which is supposed to be nice for another $1000!
I had hoped the Kit lens would at least be acceptable.
Love the camera though!

Review.author: E.C. Keith
Review.title: A great camera for family photos in any situation!

Text.text: I am far from to top notch photographer, but have always enjoyed taking photos.
I decided to up my game a little and after much research went with the A6000 over the A6300 because I really didn't need 4K video, and have nothing I could use to watch it anyway!
This camera is very easy to use and takes excellent photos.
It has so many built in functions that I am still exploring to find them all.
One of the things I really appreciate is the size.
I bought an extra lens to use for my daughters' sports and musical performances, which adds to the size.

However, with the kit lens on it, it is small enough to put into a small case (Mirrorless Mover 5, in my case) and take with you to someplace like an amusement park without any inconvenience whatsoever.

I know this isn't something that a professional photographer would be concerned with, but someone who just wants a great camera handy for family photos, or the ability to take top level photos when the situation calls for it, will be very happy with this purchase.
I am a long time Canon shooter and serious hobbyist (sometimes freelancer as well) and I have turned up my nose at these little mirrorless systems for a long time.
How could this tiny little thing possibly hold a candle to my trusty 6D?
I recently picked one of these up with a Sony 20mm 2.8 prime just to have a camera to stick in my jacket pocket at festivals and when I don't want to lug around the beast.
Well, after an mere hour cruising around the block with this thing and taking crappy little potshots I have been won over.
If you haven't shot with a good EVF before, you don't know what you're missing out on.

Live histogram, exposure preview, live zebras for clipped areas, focus peeking, variable grid patterns, really, really good focus tracking (compared to my 6D) and tons of fps on top of it all (if that's your thing).
The hype is real, people.

Here are some of my main points from my use with the camera the last 2 months.
Lightweight and lightning fast.
A bit of a learning curve with the menu settings.
The panorama setting is tricky getting the right speed.
The picture quality is exceptional.
It's easy to change out the lenses.
This camera is a great buy.
I would highly recommend checking out the video Chris Burkard did with this camera.....
Taken for what it is - which is not a full DSLR - this camera is incredibly impressive!
Lightweight, compact, and just about on par with any other crop sensor camera I've ever owned, this thing has become my go-to everyday carry camera.
